channel.title: How to make a mouse movement
channel.description: I want to make my own mouse movement, but i have no idea how to go about it. Can anyone outline me on what i basically ahve to do (not just say "Put some math and use it with movemousesmoothex" please)? thanks in advance

item.title: How to make a mouse movement
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Infintry001:

(not just say “Put some math and use it with movemousesmoothex” please)?

There’s no other way. You can’t just say to scar “0mfg plzzz mak me uberw0ber mowse movs fur ranescope”. You need to know how scar works and math. A mouse movement is a repeat of commands, using math you can determine where the mouse will go and what path it takes.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a mouse movement

item.title: How to make a mouse movement
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Yer, It is in the description of MMouse, it says that it uses try and except so as to not terminate the script if there is an error

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a mouse movement

item.title: How to make a mouse movement
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Try and except is like error catching, I’ll give an example:

[SCAR]var
x, y, z: Integer;

begin
x := 10;
y := 0;
z := x / y;
WriteLn(IntToStr(z));
end.[/SCAR]

Now, obviously, that will produce a ‘Divide by Zero’ error, but you might not know that ‘y’ would be a 0 so you can use the ‘try’ and ‘except’ method to catch things like that:

[SCAR]var
x, y, z: Integer;

begin
x := 10;
y := 0;
try
z := x / y;
WriteLn(IntToStr(z));
except
WriteLn(‘Divide by 0 error.’);
end;
end.[/SCAR]

That will catch the error and prevent the script from stopping.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a mouse movement

item.title: How to make a mouse movement
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

lmao bullzeye.

here, is every procedure\function used in mouse\mmouse, once you understand them you should know how to make a mouse.
[scar]
function MMouse(dx, dy, RandX, RandY: Integer): Boolean;
var
Path: TPointArray;
i, cx, cy, Lx, Ly, xx, yy, Math, Dist: integer;
Step, SlowDown: Extended;
begin
result := true;
if (BenMouse) then
begin
try
Dx := Dx + Random(RandX);
Dy := Dy + Random(RandY);
if Dx < 0 then Dx := 0;
if Dy < 0 then Dy := 0;
GetMousePos(cx, cy)
if not ((Cx - Dx = 0) and (Cy - Dy = 0)) then
begin
Path := MakeMouseSplinePath(cx, cy, dx, dy, 7, 50, 40);
Lx := cx;
Ly := cy;
for i := 0 to GetArrayLength(Path) - 1 do
begin
MoveMouse(Path[i].X, Path[i].Y);
Dist := Round(Sqrt((Path[i].X - Dx) * (Path[i].X - Dx) + (Path[i].Y - Dy) * (Path[i].Y - Dy)));
if Dist < 50 then
begin
SlowDown := SlowDown + (0.05 * MouseSpeed);
end;
Wait(Round(((Random(2) + MouseSpeed) / 10) * Sqrt(Sqr(Path[i].X - Lx) + Sqr(Path[i].Y - Ly)) + SlowDown));
Lx := Path[i].X;
Ly := Path[i].Y;
end;
end;
MoveMouseSmooth(dx, dy);
except
Writeln(‘Error in BenMouse’);
Writeln('Report: ’ + inttostr(cx) + ', ’ + inttostr(cy) + ’ : ’ + inttostr(dx) + ', ’ + inttostr(dy) + ’ : ’ + inttostr(mousespeed) + ‘;’);
end;
end else begin // Start Mutant/RsN MMouse
step := 4;
xx := Random(RandX);
yy := Random(RandY);
Math := Random(4) + 1;
case Math of
1: begin
dx := dx + xx;
dy := dy + yy;
end;
2: begin
dx := dx - xx;
dy := dy + yy;
end;
3: begin
dx := dx + xx;
dy := dy - yy;
end;
4: begin
dx := dx - xx;
dy := dy - yy;
end;
end;
GetMousePos(x, y);
repeat
if (Distance(x, y, dx, dy) < 100) then
if (not (Distance(x, y, dx, dy) = 0)) then
step := step - (10 / Distance(x, y, dx, dy));
if (step < 1) then
step := 1;
x := x + Round((dx - x) / step);
y := y + Round((dy - y) / step);
MoveMouse(x, y);
Wait(MouseSpeed);
until (Distance(x, y, dx, dy) = 0);
end;
end;

function MakeMouseSplinePath(Sx, Sy, Ex, Ey, MaxDist, CtrlDist, CtrlVar: integer): TPointArray;
var
Controls, Path: TPointArray;
i, pts: integer;
dist, ThetaInc, XInc, slope, b: extended;
done: boolean;
begin
dist := sqrt(pow((Sx - Ex), 2) + pow((Sy - Ey), 2));
pts := Round(dist / CtrlDist);
if pts > 12 then
begin
pts := 12;
CtrlDist := Round(dist / pts);
end;
if pts <= 1 then
begin
pts := 1
CtrlDist := Round(dist / 2) - 5;
CtrlVar := CtrlDist;
end;
repeat
done := true;
if CtrlDist * pts > Round(dist) then
begin
done := false;
pts := pts - 1;
end;
until (done);
SetArrayLength(Controls, pts + 1);
Controls[0].X := Sx;
Controls[0].Y := Sy;
if Ex - Sx <> 0 then
begin
slope := (Ey - Sy) / (Ex - Sx);
b := Sy - slope * Sx;
XInc := (Ex - Sx) / Pts;
for i := 1 to pts do
begin
Controls[i].X := Round((Sx + XInc * i) + (Random(CtrlVar * 2) - CtrlVar));
Controls[i].Y := Round((slope * (Sx + XInc * i) + b) + (Random(CtrlVar * 2) - CtrlVar));
end;
end else
begin
for i := 1 to pts do
begin
Controls[i].X := Random(CtrlVar * 2) - CtrlVar;
Controls[i].Y := Sy + ((Ey - Sy) * i) + (Random(CtrlVar * 2) - CtrlVar);
end;
end;
Controls[i - 1].X := Ex;
Controls[i - 1].Y := Ey;
if (Dist = 0) then Dist := 1.0
ThetaInc := (1.0 / (dist / 5.0));
Path := MakeSplinePath(Controls, ThetaInc);
Path := MidPoints(Path, MaxDist);
result := Path;
end;

function MakeSplinePath(Points: TPointArray; ThetaInc: Extended): TPointArray;
var
i: integer;
t: extended;
temp, last: TPoint;
done: boolean;
begin
repeat
if t >= 1 then
begin
t := 1;
done := true;
end;
temp := GetSplinePt(Points, t);
if ((temp.X <> last.X) and (temp.Y <> last.Y)) then
begin
i := i + 1;
SetArrayLength(result, i);
result[i - 1] := temp;
last := temp;
end;
t := t + ThetaInc;
until (done)
end;

function MidPoints(Path: TPointArray; MaxDist: Integer): TPointArray;
var
i, c: integer;
last: TPoint;
done: boolean;
begin
repeat
last := Path[0];
done := true;
for i := 1 to GetArrayLength(Path) - 1 do
begin
if sqrt(pow((Path[i].X - last.X), 2) + pow((Path[i].Y - last.Y), 2)) > MaxDist then
begin
done := false;
SetArrayLength(Path, GetArrayLength(Path) + 1);
for c := GetArrayLength(Path) - 1 downto i + 1 do
begin
Path[c] := Path[c - 1];
end;
Path[i].X := Round((last.X + Path[i + 1].X) / 2);
Path[i].Y := Round((last.Y + Path[i + 1].Y) / 2);
end;
last := Path[i];
end;
until (done);
result := Path;
end;

function GetSplinePt(Points: TPointArray; Theta: Extended): TPoint;
var
i, n: integer;
XTemp, YTemp: extended;
begin
n := GetArrayLength(Points) - 1;
for i := 0 to n do
begin
XTemp := XTemp + (BinCoe(n, i) * Points[i].X * pow((1 - Theta), n - i) * pow(Theta, i));
YTemp := YTemp + (BinCoe(n, i) * Points[i].Y * pow((1 - Theta), n - i) * pow(Theta, i));
end;
result.X := Round(XTemp);
result.Y := Round(YTemp);
end;

function BinCoe(a, b: LongInt): Extended;
var
x, y, z: int64;
begin
if (b >= 0) and (b <= a) then
begin
x := Fract(a);
y := Fract(b);
z := Fract(a - b);
result := (x / (y * z));
end else
result := 1.0;
end;

function Fract(number: Int64): Int64;
var
i: integer;
begin
result := 1;
if not (number = 0) then
begin
for i := 1 to number do
begin
result := result * i;
end;
end;
end;

function Distance(x1, y1, x2, y2: Integer): Integer; // By PPLSUQBAWLZ edit BenLand100
begin
Result := Round(Sqrt(Sqr(x1 - x2) + Sqr(y1 - y2)));
end;
[/scar]

Read full topic

mouse(x, y, ranx, rany, left);
end;[/scar]

item.title: How to make a mouse movement
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Its pretty complicated, I know that :P. It depends on what kind of path you want to make. I can’t help you much, except as for how to find the distance between the two points:

[SCAR]function GetDist(SX, SY, EX, EY: Integer): Extended;
begin
Result := sqrt((sqr(SX - EX) + sqr(SY - EY)));
end;[SCAR]

err if you want it fro runescape use srl’s procedure MMouse(x,y,rx,ry)
x,y are the mouse coordinates that you want move to move to,rx,ry are the randomness ofwhere mouse arrives

if just want to use MoveMouse(x,y)
Same as abov just no rx,ry
